intro: Olyra pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered olyra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and woodland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish, and it produces small, pod-like fruits. Olyra pauciflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
